intro: Hieracium subbritannicum, commonly known as the British hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or divided. Its flowering period occurs from June to August, producing yellow-orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, making it a common sight in meadows and along roadsides.
